full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 202 of 228 878 LC2VMAX6 Alessi - Direct pool, in different locations of the house. Q. Where did Mr. Epstein receive the majority of his massages? A. His bathroom. Q. And is that the bathroom attached to the master bedroom that we were talking about earlier? A. Yes. Q. What, if any, massage tables were in Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach house when you worked for him? A. We have a massage table in every guest room, and Mr. Epstein room. Q. Where in Mr. Epstein's room was the massage table? A. It was on his bathroom. Q. The same bathroom where you said he received the majority of his massages? A. Yes. Q. While you worked for Mr. Epstein, when someone called Mr. Epstein's Palm Beach house, how would employees keep track of any messages left for Mr. Epstein? A. Most of the times I will answer the phone. And I will ask who the -- they want to talk to, and they will tell me, Is Mr. Epstein at the house? I will say, Yes. He's busy. You want to leave a message? And I will write it down in a -- in a message sheet. It was this booklet. I think they have three or four messages in each booklet, and they have a carbon copy. Q. Let me ask you some questions about that. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018075
